intro: Blastemanthus gemmiflorus subsp. gemmiflorus, commonly known as the gemmiflorous blastemanthus, is a rare and unique plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
